name: Le Cerisier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Le Cerisier for one night in September and found it a very welcoming and comfortable B&B. Damien and Lisa are warm, helpful and accommodating. The decor is modern yet understated. We had dinner, which was delicious and showed care in its preparation. Having given advance notice of our needs, the owners were flexible with special dietary needs. They also were helpful with wineries and other attractions in the area. We would definitely stay at Le Cerisier again. You can't beat the price for the service.
reviews.title: Warm hosts, great dinner and nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights and ate in one night. Had an extensive meal complete with wine, coffee and digestif...excellent.
reviews.title: Comfortable and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable bed and we enjoyed the facility of a nicely presented lounge. Breakfasts are enormous.
reviews.title: Village Guest House, Good Food and Company

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our hosts were all that one could wish for and the prices were very reasonable.
reviews.title: Dinner was the highlight of our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The website lists the exact location of the premises; just as well because a lot a satnavs seem to have difficulty with new road layouts around Beziers & Magalas
reviews.title: Wonderful B and B, great hosts and fantastic food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back at Le Cerisier for another short break. This time the weather was hot in mid October (low 30's C) and enabled us to take full advantage the superb easy access beach at Serignan on a couple of days (about ½ hrs drive from St Genies) with beach towels and parasol thoughtfully provided by Damian and Lisa. On other days we drove up into the Haut Languedoc for some spectacular views and an interesting boulangerie at Salvetat sur Agout, toured Montpellier or sought out wines of the region.
reviews.title: Here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined well at Damian and Lisa's recommended restaurants but best of all at Le Cerisier where Damian's cooking was again super (and his mignon de porc outstandingly good).
reviews.title: Great to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The trip to Montpellier was made easier by the Park and Tramride facility at Sabines (exit J31 of the A9 and take the D65 [Ave d'El Alamein] for about 800yds) which provide a colourful and cheap way (€4.20 per day per car inc passengers) to access the centre of town.
reviews.title: Perfect spot outside of Beziers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of the holiday however was the hospitality of Damian and Lisa. They are great hosts and their Chambre D'Hotes is beautifully presented and maintained. We loved our bedroom.
reviews.title: lovely b and b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We'll be back whenever that nice man from Ryanair makes us an offer we can't refuse !!
reviews.title: What a lovely welcome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Short transfer from Bezier Airport around 20minutes set in the French countryside.
reviews.title: Outstanding, relaxing getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted with a complimentary drink, choice of; Coffee, Tea, Wine, Beer.
reviews.title: Just perfect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property consists of 4 modern guest rooms, twins, doubles, and an apartment on the top floor. The apartment has a Southley facing balcony perfect for soaking up the rays watching the sun set over the French countryside. The B&B was clean throughout. Rooms come with bottle water, and tea/coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B - well worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food was top class, all homemade and freshly prepared by host Damien. We stayed 6 nights and the menu was varied each night. Even the breakfast was different each morning!
reviews.title: Peaceful, rural location with great character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hostess Lisa really made us feel welcomed making sure we were fine, and there to assist us if we needed any help getting about or planning activities.
reviews.title: Excellent in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are travelling to the south of France by car, Le Cérisier is a perfect Bed&Breakfast run by Damian and Lisa who will make you feel like at home. The rooms are so nice, clean and functional and every detail of them has been accurately and lovely thought as well as the common areas, dinning room and sitting room. They offer a delicious breakfast in the morning, with typical French croissants and pastries, you should not miss. It may be a bit noisy in the morning if the apartment upstairs has been booked, but nothing really to worry about. Rooms do not have TV’s anyway. Soaps, shampoo, shower gel, hairdryer, kettle, biscuits, chocolates, bottle opener, bathrobes, clean towels are some of the things you will nicely find placed with love in your room. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, eight year old daughter, and I really enjoyed our long weekend stay at Le Cerisier.
reviews.title: Great quality and service - thoroughly enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lisa and Damian couldn't have been more helpful and friendly, always available if needed and gave us some useful info on the village and surrounding area to help us organise our days.
reviews.title: lovely rooms, very welcoming and we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ensuite room we had was clean, bright and suited the family well. We particularly like the attention to detail with ample linen, towels, night robes and toiletries.
reviews.title: A Superior B&B ~ Welcoming Hosts Dedicated to Your Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were made very welcome and certainly felt at home.
reviews.title: We came back

description: The charming bed and breakfast, Le Cerisier is located in the village of Saint Geniès de Fontédit in the Herault region of Languedoc. The village is only 10 miles north of Béziers with easy access to Narbonne, Montpellier, Carcassonne, and Perpignan along the A9.We are centrally located close to : Some of the most excellent beaches France has to offer within 20 miles drive The beautiful Canal du Midi less than 15 miles away .
